Or an alternative explanation may be that  the cameras that capture these images use an incredibly low shutter speed in order to parse the dark low light conditions of space which then produced photographic artifacts of gases in the atmosphere of the planet which would show up as motion blur trails similar to how a photographer paints with light using the low shutter speed with a digital SLR. But, I have no idea what kinds of cameras they're using, so it's just a simplistic guess based on what it looks like to me. I've created all kinds of neat artifact patterns and trails when I have my DSLR cranked down super low. Many of them have looked exactly like this.
